docs.lead_paragraph: Puerto Rico, whose leaders have complained of unequal federal treatment on healthcare, may get some help from the state with the most Puerto Rican citizens outside the island itself - New York.

headline.main: New York Governor Cuomo Pledges Healthcare Help to Puerto Rico
headline.print_headline: New York Governor Cuomo Pledges Healthcare Help to Puerto Rico

docs.snippet: Puerto Rico, whose leaders have complained of unequal federal treatment on healthcare, may get some help from the state with the most Puerto Rican citizens outside the island itself - New York.

docs.lead_paragraph: About 9.9 million people have signed up and paid for health insurance under President Barack Obama's health care law, the administration said Tuesday, a slight dip from a previous count but on track toward the administration's year-end goal of 9.1 million.

headline.main: Health Insurance Signups Near 10 Million in Midyear Report

docs.lead_paragraph: The president of French rugby club Toulon denied on Tuesday that any of his team members were implicated in doping after prosecutors confirmed several pharmacies were under investigation on suspicion of improperly supplying medication.

headline.main: French Rugby Club Toulon Denies Involvement in Prescription Drug Probe
headline.print_headline: French Rugby Club Toulon Denies Involvement in Prescription Drug Probe

headline.main: Busting the Myths About Disability Fraud

docs.abstract: There’s no evidence that fraud is rampant in the disability system — in fact, qualifying for disability is very difficult.

docs.lead_paragraph: Angered by videos in which Planned Parenthood officials discussed compensation for providing fetal tissue from abortions, Republicans in Congress are again demanding an end to government funding for the nearly 100-year-old provider of women’s health services.

headline.main: Planned Parenthood Faces Unexpected Challenge From Obamacare
headline.print_headline: Planned Parenthood Faces Unexpected Challenge From Obamacare

docs.lead_paragraph: Two new powerful drugs have been approved. The question is whether the benefits will outweigh the long-term costs.
docs.abstract: Editorial expresses concern about very high price of cholesterol drugs Praluent and Repatha, which could outweigh their benefits; notes that both drugs cost about $14,000 per month to take, and most patients prescribed drugs will need to take them for lifetime; underscores necessity for more competition to drive down prices, and for insurers to push pharmaceutical companies for larger discounts.
docs.snippet: Two new powerful drugs have been approved. The question is whether the benefits will outweigh the long-term costs.

docs.lead_paragraph: The American Medical Association says the proposed merger of Anthem and Cigna, along with that of Aetna and Humana, could reduce competition in 154 metropolitan areas in 23 states.

headline.main: Doctors’ Association Sees Harm in Insurance Mergers
headline.print_headline: Doctors’ Association Sees Harm in Insurance Mergers

docs.abstract: Study conducted by the American Medical Assn finds that Anthem's planned acquisition of Cigna, as well as proposed merger between Aetna and Humana, would significantly reduce competition in the already highly-consolidated insurance industry; finds mergers would affect 154 metropolitan areas in 23 states.
docs.snippet: The American Medical Association says the proposed merger of Anthem and Cigna, along with that of Aetna and Humana, could reduce competition in 154 metropolitan areas in 23 states.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Most businesses know the cost of everything that goes into producing what they sell — essential information for setting prices. Medicine is different.

headline.main: What Are a Hospital’s Costs? Utah System Is Trying to Learn
headline.print_headline: What Are a Hospital’s Costs? Utah System Is Trying to Learn

docs.abstract: Cost of medical care at University of Utah Health Care has fallen by 0.5 percent annually, in reverse of current trend, attracting attention of other hospital systems; process by which hospital system determines actual costs in order to pare expenses and improve care has been set in place by Dr Vivian Lee; issue acquires more urgency as Affordable Care Act moves toward one-payment system for hospitals.
docs.snippet: Most businesses know the cost of everything that goes into producing what they sell — essential information for setting prices. Medicine is different.
